alert.note: Alert for Angelina; Nacogdoches; Sabine; San Augustine; Shelby (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 25 at 6:51AM CDT until August 25 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR CRITICAL TO EXTREME FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS FOR DEEP EAST TEXAS AND ALL OF NORTHERN AND CENTRAL LOUISIANA... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR CRITICAL TO EXTREME FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS IN DEEP EAST TEXAS AND ALL OF NORTHERN AND CENTRAL LOUISIANA... * AFFECTED AREAS...Fire districts in Deep East Texas and all of Northern and Central Louisiana. * TIMING...Through 8 PM this evening. * WINDS...South-Southwest winds 5 to 10 mph this morning becoming variable in the afternoon. Locally gusty winds are possible in and near isolated thunderstorms that develop this afternoon. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 30 percent. * TEMPERATURES...Up to 108 degrees. * IMPACTS...Rapid ignition and spread of wildfires is possible due to persistent hot and dry conditions.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that extreme fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and dry vegetation can contribute to extreme fire behavior. Avoid all outside burning and welding today. Do not toss lit cigarette butts outside. Report wild fires to the nearest fire department or law enforcement office.
